questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'abrogate'?
questions.explanation: Abrogate means to repeal or abolish a law or agreement; 'ratify' means to formally approve or confirm it.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'abstemious'?
questions.explanation: Abstemious means self-denying in food or drink; 'indulgent' means yielding freely to desires.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'intransigent'?
questions.explanation: Intransigent means refusing to compromise; 'conciliatory' means willing to compromise or pacify.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'abject' (as in abject misery)?
questions.explanation: Abject means extremely low or degraded; 'elevated' suggests a raised or improved condition.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'bellicose'?
questions.explanation: Bellicose means warlike or aggressive; 'pacific' means peace-loving and opposed to conflict.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'censure' (verb)?
questions.explanation: To censure is to criticize harshly; 'commend' means to formally praise or approve.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'dissemble'?
questions.explanation: Dissemble means to conceal true motives or feelings; 'reveal' means to make them known.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'obstreperous'?
questions.explanation: Obstreperous means noisy and difficult to control; 'tractable' means easily managed or controlled.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'prosaic'?
questions.explanation: Prosaic means dull and lacking poetic beauty; 'poetic' suggests heightened, imaginative language.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'soporific'?
questions.explanation: Soporific means sleep-inducing; 'stimulating' means energizing or arousing interest.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'excoriate'?
questions.explanation: Excoriate means to criticize severely; 'extol' means to praise enthusiastically.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'recondite'?
questions.explanation: Recondite means obscure or difficult to understand; 'accessible' means easy to understand.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'ascetic'?
questions.explanation: Ascetic means practicing severe self-denial; 'hedonistic' centers life around pleasure.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'obfuscate'?
questions.explanation: Obfuscate means to make something unclear; 'illuminate' means to make it clear or understandable.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'craven'?
questions.explanation: Craven means cowardly; 'courageous' is the direct opposite in character.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'jejune'?
questions.explanation: Jejune means superficial or intellectually shallow; 'profound' means deep and thoughtful.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'pell-mell'?
questions.explanation: Pell-mell means in a confused, rushed way; 'orderly' means arranged or done systematically.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'trenchant'?
questions.explanation: Trenchant means sharply effective or clear-cut; 'vague' means unclear or imprecise.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'aberrant'?
questions.explanation: Aberrant means deviating from the norm; 'normal' is standard or usual.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'unctuous'?
questions.explanation: Unctuous describes insincere, oily flattery; 'sincere' means genuinely felt or expressed.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'inimical'?
questions.explanation: Inimical means hostile or harmful; 'friendly' is socially opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'prolix'?
questions.explanation: Prolix means excessively wordy; 'succinct' means expressed in few words.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'picayune'?
questions.explanation: Picayune means trivial or of little value; 'significant' means important or meaningful.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'adamant'?
questions.explanation: Adamant means refusing to change one's mind; 'yielding' means willing to give way.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'obdurate'?
questions.explanation: Obdurate means stubbornly hard-hearted; 'soft-hearted' suggests easily moved and compassionate.
